title: Jarvis Cocker attends Q Awards 2019 with Extinction Rebellion
text:
Jarvis was in good company (Picture: Rex Features)

Jarvis Cocker made quite a big arrival at the Q Awards 2019 red carpet, as he was joined by Extinction Rebellion protestors.

The Pulp frontman rocked up to the prestigious music awards held at London’s Roundhouse in Camden on Wednesday afternoon with an interesting entourage.

The 56-year-old musician swaggered onto the red carpet holding a small blue poster with ‘rebel for life’ on the front and the Extinction Rebellion symbol.

He was then joined by three protestors who all banded together to hold up a large banner with the phrase: ‘No music on a dead planet,’ across the front.

Before gracing the red carpet, the protestors had spent weeks campaigning for climate change action around London.

But the Metropolitan Police decided to ban all Extinction Rebellion protests across the capital from Tuesday night.

Foals frontman Yannis Phillippakis spoke about the XR protests on the Q Awards red carpet, and supported their mission in raising awareness about climate change issues.

Jarvis has picked his side of the cause (Picture: Rex Features)

The Pulp singer proudly supports XR (Picture: Getty Images)

‘I think obviously it causes huge inconvenience to people but I think by causing that inconvenience it allows and promotes the messages that need to be gotten across to come to the forefront of consciousness,’ he said.

‘I think people have been aware about climate issues of all types for a long time but they remain in the middle of the newspaper, something you can bat away.

‘And the thing XR are doing is they’re then bringing it into people’s faces and they’re making it uncomfortable so we have to confront the problems that are there.

‘So yeah, what they’re doing is important.’

The Q Awards will hand out 18 awards tonight, including new categories Q song of the decade and Q best vocal performance.

Billie EIlish, Lewis Capaldi, Stormzy and The 1975 appear to be the hot contenders, going up against each other in categories like best album, best track and best solo act.

The Q Award winners will be announced in full tonight.
